intro: Odoptera aurea, commonly known as the golden stinkbug, is a species of planthopper found in tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Fulgoridae and is characterized by its elongated, shield-shaped body and distinctive golden coloration. The plant is primarily herbivorous, feeding on the sap of various plants, particularly those in the families Fabaceae and Malvaceae. Its wings are transparent and veined, which aid in camouflage among leaves. The species is known for its ability to emit a foul odor as a defense mechanism against predators.
